intro: Jurinea cordata, commonly known as the heart-leaved jurinea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are heart-shaped, which gives it its common name, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. Jurinea cordata is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand cold and harsh climatic conditions.
